chunks.title: VAT Overview
chunks.content: Value-Added Tax (VAT) is a consumption tax imposed on the sale, barter, exchange, or lease of goods or properties and services in the Philippines, as well as on the importation of goods. Standard rate: 12% (since 2006). Zero-rated: 0% (export sales, services to non-residents). VAT-exempt: Not subject to VAT.

chunks.title: VAT Registration Threshold
chunks.content: Businesses with annual gross sales/receipts exceeding PHP 3,000,000 must register as VAT taxpayers. Below threshold: Optional VAT registration or Percentage Tax (3%).

chunks.title: Output VAT
chunks.content: Output VAT is collected from buyers on sale of goods/services. Computed as: Selling Price x 12%. Must be separately indicated in invoices/receipts.

chunks.title: Input VAT
chunks.content: Input VAT is paid to suppliers on purchases of goods/services/capital goods. Creditable against Output VAT. Must be supported by VAT invoices/receipts.

chunks.title: VAT Payable Formula
chunks.content: VAT Payable = Output VAT - Input VAT. If Input VAT > Output VAT: Excess carried forward to next period. Excess input VAT can be applied for refund after 2 years (for zero-rated sales).

chunks.title: Filing Deadlines
chunks.content: Monthly VAT (BIR 2550M): Within 20 days after end of each month. Quarterly VAT (BIR 2550Q): Within 25 days after end of each quarter.

chunks.title: Zero-Rated Sales
chunks.content: Zero-rated sales include: Export sales; Sales to PEZA registered enterprises; Services rendered to non-resident foreign persons; Transport of passengers and cargo by domestic air or sea vessels from Philippines to abroad.

chunks.title: VAT-Exempt Transactions
chunks.content: VAT-exempt transactions include: Agricultural and marine food products in original state; Educational services; Medical, dental, hospital, veterinary services; Employment services; Residential lot (PHP 1,919,500 or below); Residential dwelling (PHP 3,199,200 or below); Sale of drugs and medicines for diabetes, hypertension, cholesterol.
